examples: The plans for the new development have raised angry protests from local residents.
His angry glance said it all.
A hungry man is an angry man after all.
My grandmother got angry when I accidentally spilled juice on the carpet.
My boss was so angry that I really got the rough edge of his tongue.
words.defineEn: feeling very annoyed or upset because of something that we do not like
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất khó chịu hoặc khó chịu vì điều gì đó mà chúng tôi không thích

examples: He's just too lazy to come.
The lazy employee's work was not worth a brass farthing, and he was eventually fired for his lack of effort.
He can be lazy about doing his work, but when he gets the bit between his teeth there's no stopping him.
I enjoy reading a book or watching a movie during the lazy afternoon hours.
She calls him lazy and useless, but it's water off a duck's back to him
words.defineEn: not liking physical activity or unwilling to work
words.defineVi: không thích hoạt động thể chất hoặc không muốn làm việc

examples: The library is often quiet during weekdays.
Be quiet, please.
We lead a very quiet life.
Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
You've been awfully quiet tonight, honey.
words.defineEn: making very little noise or no noise at all
words.defineVi: tạo ra rất ít tiếng ồn hoặc không có tiếng ồn nào cả

examples: Oh yeah, that was sad.
That's pretty sad if you ask me.
Sad, woe is us, to come to this plight!
She would cry at the drop of a hat when watching sad movies.
It would be humorous if it weren't so sad the way Sarah tiptoes around her wife.
Her condition is very serious.
He avoided serious injury following a head-first fall on to the ice.
The thrill-seeker who skydived without proper safety precautions ended up with a serious injury.
Riding a bike without a helmet may seem like harmless fun, but it can have serious consequences.
Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
words.defineEn: bad or dangerous; significant or worrying due to a possible danger or risk
words.defineVi: xấu hoặc nguy hiểm; đáng kể hoặc đáng lo ngại do nguy hiểm hoặc rủi ro có thể xảy ra

examples: The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
The slow healing process of the wound required regular care.
The slow elevator took a long time to reach the desired floor.
Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.
She had a slow learning pace but never gave up.
words.defineEn: moving, happening, or being done at a speed that is low
words.defineVi: di chuyển, xảy ra hoặc được thực hiện ở tốc độ thấp
